definition: to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: A spectator is admitted by ticket only.
sentences.chinese: 1每一名觀衆都必須憑票入場。

sentences.english: 1 1 A spectator is admitted by ticket only.
sentences.chinese: 1每一名觀衆都必須憑票入場。

sentences.english: Admission by tickets, 2 yuan each, obtainable at the booking-office of the auditorium.
sentences.chinese: 憑票入場，票價每張兩元，可到大禮堂售票處購買。
